page.title: 06TRANSPORT: Costs
page.content:
Transport costs concern many people, particularly those in rural areas.
A{car}costs Â£100 each year in Road Tax. Insurance costs about the same. Petrol, in October 1985 is about Â£2 a gallon. A typical car costs about 25 pence a mile to run.
{Bus}fares vary. A 12 mile journey costs about Â£1 but the first part of the trip up to two miles can cost about 50 pence.
Long distance{coach}journeys can be very cheap. 400 miles from London to Glasgow can cost about Â£20.
{Train}fares average out at around 7 pence a mile but there are many different special fare offers and low-cost ticket schemes.
